meanings.definition: A pair of photographs that give a three-dimensional effect when viewed together.
meanings.sent1: I looked at the stereograph and felt like the objects were popping out of the picture.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a fascinating stereograph of an ancient city.
meanings.sent3: When I accidentally crossed my eyes while looking at the stereograph, the 3D effect disappeared.
meanings.sent4: Her memories seemed like a stereograph, vivid and lifelike.
meanings.sent5: The artist's stereograph of the forest made me feel like I could step into the scene.

meanings.definition: To create a stereograph by taking two photographs from slightly different angles.
meanings.sent1: He decided to stereograph the landscape to capture its depth.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often stereograph scenes to enhance the visual experience.
meanings.sent3: I will stereograph our group photo to make it look more interesting.
meanings.sent4: She likes to stereograph nature to show its beauty in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The artist will stereograph the city skyline to create a stunning 3D effect.
